text:
Created attachment 32068
Basic patch to update the label after the post-processor runs. Someone more familiar with the codebase may be able to suggest a better way to implement this more efficiently.

If we have a test plan with the following layout

Thread Group
 - Sampler ${foo}
    - Pre-processor
 - Sampler2 ${foo}
 - Listener


The if the variable foo is set by the pre-processor then the value will appear in the label for both Sampler and Sampler2. 

Thread Group
 - Sampler ${foo}
    - Post-Processor
 - Sampler2 ${foo}
 - Listener


If it is set by the post-processor then the value will not appear for first sampler, but will appear in the second sampler Sampler2. It appears the label isn't updated after the post-processor runs.

This is an annoyance when trying to correlate response times with the type of response (when we can't know beforehand).
